setup.question: Which three things do Venusians love about Terrans?
answers:
Terran idioms, Terran cigarettes, and the Terran interest in Venus. 
The name “Joe,” Terran cigarettes, and their fun jokes.

Text.text: give context with quotes

2. cigarettes the same for both answers
3. provide me evidence that the villages are Terrans villages. Also that the Venusians love it

The planet is Venus - the Joes are all Venusians, a name they borrowed from Terran culture:

almost childish people. It appealed to them-the Joe business, I mean. Now they're all Joe. They like it. That and the cigarettes."
cigarettes is answered by the above ^^
3. im confused by your question - these villages are on the planet Venus. they are inhabitated by native Venusians. 
more ev for jokes that ill verify next round if you need me to:
"No," Joe replied. "I like Terrans too, you understand. They are good for Venus. And they are fun."

"Fun?" I asked, thinking of a particular species of Terran: species Leonard Walsh.

"Yes, yes," he said wholeheartedly. "They joke and they laugh and ... well, you know."

"I suppose so," I admitted.

1) If the natives are from Venus and only just now becoming acquainted with Terran culture then how would could everyone be named Joe. Also give me more context around "What's with all this Joe business? It may be a very original name but I think its popularity here is a little outstanding." I assume there is an answer to this question and you have not provided it which points to me that you are lying.
2. you don't have to prove they love Terrans cigarettes it is true for both answers. That is the only thing I know is true rn.
3. Give me the actual quotes. thank you!

you are assuming wrong then:
i literally quoted the answer - he says the Terran ppl (the enlisted men) started calling the Venusians Joe and they adapted to it. The natives (Venusians) being simple, just took it on. Your curiosity about it being recent is irrelevant - its probably not their birth name its just a universal thing they respond to. 
 here is more of Bransten's response:

i cannot quote the entire thing due to limits but ill paste it:
"What's with all this Joe business? It may be a very original name but I think its popularity here is a little outstanding."

Captain Bransten began to chuckle softly. I personally didn't think it was so funny. I tossed him my withering Superior Officer's gaze and waited for his explanation.

"I hadn't realized this was your first time on Venus," he said.

"Is there a local hero named Joe?" I asked.

"No, no, nothing like that," he assured me. "It's a simple culture, you know. Not nearly as developed as Mars."

"I can see that," I said bitingly.

"And the natives are only now becoming acquainted with Terran culture. Lots of enlisted men, you know."
3. gonna quote last speech

You make the claim that they borrowed Joe from Terran culture. If we combine the two that means they are just now borrowing now borrowing Terran's culture. So that leads me to question how is everyone named Joe. Answering my curiosity by calling irrelevant is not an answer. so next speech break it up so you can include the whole quote. Also the question is what are three things Venusians love about Terrans. so what qualities does the Venusians love about the Terran. Your explanation shows that the Venusian people gave the Terran that name. It doesn't answer the question.

If you vote A its your funeral this is like the freest round possible.
I did answer your question: The Terrans use the name Joe - this is because Terrans when on Venus would call the local Venusians Joe.

some cigarettes?' Do you follow?". I told you your question is irrelevant because it is - we have no idea if Joe is their birth name - its just what everyone calls everyone else because their culture is new and they adapted based on the Terran army men's namecalling when they were stationed on Venus - something I already evidenced. 
You ask what qualities does the Venusians love about the Terran? The name Joe which ive now shown like probably 700 characters of evidence, the cigarettes which is in both answers and the fun jokes. I have no idea what is unclear at this point. There is zero evidence pointing to Terran interest in Venus. I can't even cite it because it doesn't exist. Venusians don't care about the Terran interest in Venus. Idioms are used exactly once in the whole story.
